item.title: Court orders arrest of journalist Anis Alamgir in graft case
item.description: A court has ordered that journalist Anis Alamgir be placed under arrest in a case filed by the Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) over allegations of acquiring assets beyond known sources of income. The order was issued on Wednesday by Dhaka Metropolitan Senior Special Judge Md Sabbir Fayez followin

item.title: US Ambassador Christensen meets CEC
item.description: US Ambassador to Bangladesh Brent Christensen has held a meeting with Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin in Dhaka amid preparations for the upcoming 13th parliamentary elections. The meeting began around 11:45am on Wednesday at the Nirbachan Bhaban in Agargaon. This was Christensen&rsquo

item.title: BUBT Economics Department Hosts Insightful Session on "Research Methodology: Economic Advancement in Real Life" During Research Week of the University
item.description: The Department of Economics at Bangladesh University of Business and Technology (BUBT) organized a keynote session titled "Research Methodology: Advancement in Real Life" as part of its Research Week festivities. item.title: Rebuilding human capital biggest challenge for next govt: Wahiduddin
item.description: Planning Adviser Dr Wahiduddin Mahmud on Wednesday said the foremost challenge for the next government will be rebuilding human capital and strengthening governance, alongside preserving fragile macroeconomic stability following years of structural decline and a series of economic shocks. “F

item.title: Dhaka court sentences ‘Cross-eyed Robin’ to death over 2015 Jurain murder
item.description: A Dhaka court has sentenced Robin, alias “Cross-eyed Robin”, to death for the shooting and killing of a young man named Sohel in Jurain’s Rishipara around 11 years ago. The verdict was delivered on Wednesday by Dhaka Additional Metropolitan Sessions Judge Md Khorshed Alam, bdnews

item.title: Hajj arrangements underway smoothly according to roadmap: Adviser Khalid
item.description: Religious Affairs Adviser Dr A F M Khalid Hossain on Wednesday said all preparations for Hajj are progressing according to the roadmap. The Ministry of Religious Affairs is working relentlessly to complete cent percent accommodation contracts within the stipulated timeframe, he said during a meeti

item.title: US ready to work with any elected government in Bangladesh: Christensen
item.description: The United States will take no side in Bangladesh’s election and is prepared to work with whichever government is chosen by voters, according to US Ambassador Brent Christensen. Speaking to reporters after meeting Bangladesh’s Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin in Dhaka on Wed

item.title: Adani boosts power supply to Bangladesh despite souring diplomatic ties
item.description: India's Adani Power is boosting electricity exports to Bangladesh, data from both governments showed, despite worsening bilateral relations and a Bangladesh government-appointed panel calling the supply overpriced. item.title: Daffodil International University celebrates its 13th Convocation
item.description: Daffodil International University (DIU) held its 13th Convocation today, Wednesday (28 January 2026), at Daffodil Smart City, with the participation of 4,020 graduating students from undergraduate and postgraduate programs. item.title: EBL launches Trade Hub at Chattogram EPZ
item.description: Eastern Bank PLC (EBL) has officially launched a dedicated Trade Hub at the Chattogram Export Processing Zone (CEPZ) to provide specialised trade-related banking services for customers operating within the CEPZ area. The EBL CEPZ Trade Hub has been specifically designed to expedite import and expo

item.title: 510 tonnes of rice imported from India reach Benapole
item.description: A total of 510 tonnes of parboiled rice have been imported from India through the Benapole Land Port in Jashore after a gap of three months, with the import cost standing at Tk 50 per kg.
